metadata.title: CVE-2021-22573 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: The vulnerability is that IDToken verifier does not verify if token isproperly signed. Signature verification makes sure that the token's payloadcomes from valid provider, not from someone else. An attacker can provide acompromised token with custom payload. The token will pass the validationon the client side. We recommend upgrading to version 1.33.3 or above

criterions.comment: google-oauth-client-java package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
